Dear Courtney LYNN-SMITH Atkins:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
12/05/2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation
(6) An agency shall do all the following:
(a) Provide the foster parent with a copy of the report
required by subrule (5) of this rule within 10 calendar
days of its completion.
In one of one special evaluation reviewed documentation was not located to confirm
the foster parent received a copy of the completed special evaluation. There was
documentation at the time of the initiation of the special evaluation that the foster
parents were informed they could include their response to the evaluation upon its
completion.
CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation
(6) An agency shall do all the following:
(c) Provide a copy of the report to any social services
worker that has children placed in the home.
In one of one special evaluation reviewed documentation was not located to
determine the foster care worker who had children in the home was given a copy of
the completed special evaluation.
CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation
2

(7) If any violations are cited and there is a signed
corrective action plan, all social service workers who
have children placed in the home must be notified there
is a corrective action plan and what is required of the
foster parent in that plan.
One of one special evaluation reviewed required a corrective action plan.
Documentation was not located to indicate the foster care worker with children in the
home received a copy of the corrective action plan that was required as a part of the
special evaluation.

VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The
agency submitted a CAP for the renewal evaluation completed 9/20/2023. The
area identified in noncompliance was FOM 722-06B. This was not identified in
noncompliance as a part of this interim evaluation. The CAP was approved
09/25/2023 by DCWL.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment reported staff training for the noncompliance
and the use of quality improvement tools. The agency was found to be in
compliance with the completion of the CAP.
Financial Overview
N/A
Staff Interviews
3

Child Welfare Staff participated in entrance and exit conferences. Individual staff
interviews did not indicate any areas of concern.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care, licensing and independent living services. All files were
stored securely and there is a cross shredder for CHRI.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Safety Alert #1: The home needed a door alarm for a door leading to a possible
water hazard.
Resolution: A door alarm was provided/installed and checked with a visit and picture
documentation was also provided for confirmation. The CAP was approved
5/15/2024 by DCWL.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
